  "concepts": [
    {"term": "nonlinear system", "category": "mathematics"},
    {"term": "logistic map", "category": "mathematics"},
    {"term": "population", "category": "mathematics"},
    {"term": "growth rate", "category": "mathematics"},
    {"term": "nonlinear term", "category": "mathematics"},
    {"term": "environment’s limits", "category": "mathematics"},
    {"term": "resources", "category": "mathematics"},
    {"term": "stabilizes", "category": "mathematics"},
    {"term": "declines", "category": "mathematics"}
  ],
  "evidence": [
    "One famous example of a nonlinear system is the logistic map",
    "describes how a population—say, of rabbits—evolves over time",
    "next year’s population depends on this year’s population and a growth rate factor, r",
    "because of the nonlinear term involving the population itself",
    "the system’s behavior changes dramatically depending on the value of r",
    "growth slows—resources become scarce, and the population stabilizes or even declines"
  ]
}

evidence: One famous example of a nonlinear system is the logistic map
describes how a population-say, of rabbits-evolves over time
next year’s population depends on this year’s population and a growth rate factor, r
because of the nonlinear term involving the population itself
the system’s behavior changes dramatically depending on the value of r
growth slows-resources become scarce, and the population stabilizes or even declines
